document.ModsDocTitle: Four new species of Trigonopterus Fauvel from the island of New Britain (Coleoptera, Curculionidae)
document.docAuthor: Van Dam, Matthew H., Laufa, Raymond & Riedel, Alexander
document.docTitle: Trigonopterus obsidianus Van Dam & Riedel, sp. n.
document.masterDocTitle: Four new species of Trigonopterus Fauvel from the island of New Britain (Coleoptera, Curculionidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Four new species of Trigonopterus Fauvel from the island of New Britain (Coleoptera, Curculionidae)

caption.paragraph: Figure 2. Trigonopterus obsidianus Van Dam & Riedel, sp. n., holotype; a Dorsal habitus b Lateral habitus c Penis.

subSubSection.paragraph: Holotype (ANIC): ARC4216 (GenBank # KU888896), Papua New Guinea: West New Britain Prov.: E of Silali Village, Nakanai Range, S05°31.233' , E151°03.343' , 800 m, from foliage, 21-22-XI-2014. Paratypes (SMNK, UPNG): 2 exx, ARC4215 (GenBank # KU888895), ARC4217 (GenBank # KU888897), same data as holotype.
This epithet is based on the Latin adjective obsidianus and refers to the color of the polished mineral obsidian, which resembles the pronotum and elytra of this species.

This species belongs to the Trigonopterus politus -group of Riedel et al. (2013b) and is similar to Trigonopterus politus (Faust) of the Papuan Peninsula. It can be distinguished by the symmetrical apex of the penis and the less distinct denticles of the male metatibia.
